required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pelvic and Acetabular Fracture: A Prospective Observational Study
clinical_study.official_title: Functional, Clinical, and Performance Outcomes Following Pelvic and Acetabular Fracture: A Prospective Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to understand the trajectory of function and self-reported outcomes of patients following pelvic and acetabular, treated both operatively and nonoperatively.

detailed_description.textblock: The goal of the study study is to prospectively capture data from patients following pelvic and acetabular fractures, treated both operatively and nonoperatively, in order to understand the trajectory of functional and self-reported outcomes as well as to answer critical questions about treatment. Performance assessment data and patient-reported outcome measures utilizing the NIH PROMIS tool will be collected and analyzed for patients following pelvic or acetabular fracture, regardless of treatment.

primary_outcome.description: Average time to return to work and activities

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in patient-reported outcomes measurement information system (PROMIS 29) scores
secondary_outcome.description: The PROMIS-29 assesses seven health domains: physical function, anxiety, depression, fatigue, sleep disturbance, pain interference, and ability to participate in social roles and activities. Each of the seven domains has four questions which are scored on a five-point Likert scale. The PROMIS-29 scales will be scored using a T-score metric method available at the Assessment Center website (http://assessmentcenter.net). A score of 50 points represents the population average for each scale, and 10 points represent one standard deviation. Higher scores mean more of the specific scale's construct, which may indicate a desirable or an undesirable outcome.
Union rates as measured clinically and radiographically. Xrays will be collected from the electronic medical record.
Rates of readmission, reoperations and complications

Participants complete a modified 10 meter walk test which involves the subject starting from a standing position, walking 5 meters at a comfortable pace, turning around, and then walking back 5 meters to the original starting point. The test is repeated twice for each subject.

secondary_outcome.measure: Performance Measure- Five Time Sit to Stand Test
secondary_outcome.description: Participants begin from a seated position and are directed to come to a full standing position without push off assistance from upper extremities and then return to a seated position without upper extremity assist.

secondary_outcome.measure: Performance Measure- Timed Up and Go Test
secondary_outcome.description: Participants begin in a seated position. They are directed to stand and walk 3 meters to a cone on the floor. They are to round the cone in a continuous motion, walk back to the chair, turn again and be seated. The entire test is performed at a comfortable and safe speed for the patient.

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated for pelvic or acetabular fracture at an orthopaedic trauma practices.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Fracture of the pelvic ring
- Fracture of the acetabulum
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients unwilling to provide consent to participate.
